attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Intel 80386, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, for GNU/Linux 2.2.5, stripped

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detect the Bifrost backdor based on strings
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Sekoia.io

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: The sample is a statically-linked ELF binary that performs extensive system fingerprinting by reading files such as /proc/cpuinfo, /proc/meminfo, and /proc/sys/kernel/version. It attempts to establish a covert Command and Control (C2) channel using DNS, with a hardcoded DNS server IOC: 168.95.1.1. Furthermore, the binary contains strings and logic (e.g., referencing '/usr/lib/gconv' and checking SUID/SGID status) highly indicative of an attempt to exploit a privilege escalation vulnerability in the glibc dynamic loader, such as Looney Tunables (CVE-2023-4911).
